title: [NEW] Having issues Patching 6.10? Click Here!
body:
>#Update 5/18:

>We've been seeing many reports of players getting a "The game has crashed" message when they try to enter the Loading Screen after Champ Select.  From our initial investigation, ***this seems to be due to LoLReplay interacting oddly with the latest patch.***

>In order to get this resolved, we strongly recommend that you temporarily and completely uninstall LoLReplay.

-------------------------------------------

Hey everyone,

With 6.10 heralding our resident Stone Weaver Taliyah to the Rift, it means just one thing:  Really.  Bad. Rock puns.  Don't worry, we'll keep this thread pretty down to earth though.

http://i.imgur.com/12EV232.gifv

If your patching progress gets petrified, follow some of the easy steps below, or post your problem if you can't find a solution and we'll help you out!
----------------------------------------------

>#***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scan already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

>#***Patcher never pops up, or disappears after you press "LAUNCH"***

This can be caused by corruption with the patcher itself or it failed to properly self-patch. Additionally, it may be due to some issues with the configuration of your computer system's permissions (meaning it can't properly save the files in the correct location). To resolve this, make sure to complete all the steps in our [Patching Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues)!

>#***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. Many of the most common Anti-virus programs [have already whitelisted LoL](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3), however make sure to update yours to the latest version!

Also, even though you may have set specific exceptions in place before for your security program, League of Legends has gone through a major update. Therefore, your security program may recognize the old version of League of Legends, but not the new version. 

To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

--------------------------------------------------------------

*If after completing these steps, and you still do not see the glorious orange 'LAUNCH' button, feel free to drop us a post in this thread!  Rioters as well as Wrenchmen volunteers will be on hand to respond and provide some additional help!*

I keep getting the "Update failed, Unspecified error has occurred" message. I have never had this happen before and I have never had an issues installing a patch before. My internet is fine and I even restarted it to see if I could update. This is happening because of the 6.10 patch.  Like I said, I don't understand how this can be client-sided since this has never happened before. All the other patches have worked fine and fast for me.

PLEASE HELP!

i got the same problem. It doesn't even starts loading right?
im guessing riot doesnt care that many of us are having problems {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

They do care, but the reason you're having problems is likely because when linked a KB from a Rioter, many players may be skipping important steps because they simply "don't want to" or "don't think it will fix the problem. The commonly skipped steps are:

1. [Switch to a wired connection](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq2) (WiFi is convenient, but it's terrible for gaming, and often provides an unstable connection)

2. Uninstall your Firewall or Antivirus completely. Simply disabling it won't do the trick in a lot of cases, so taking a few minutes to get rid of it completely to see if it resolves the issue won't kill your computer.

3. [Switch to a public DNS server](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5), as your ISP's default DNS servers are slower to look up servers you connect to, and this is a simple, yet commonly effective fix for a lot of connection issues. 

4. [Try a VPN (Virtual Private Network)](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq9) to reroute your connection. If this causes a change, it means the problem is with your ISP and the way they route your connection to the League servers. Reaching out to a tier 2 agent at your ISP and letting them know a VPN was a successful workaround for your issue can point them towards running traceroutes and figuring out where the connection is running into trouble. Hotspot Shield and Tunnelbear arre the two most effective VPN's to give a go.

If a player still runs into issues after taking those steps, they'll want to reach out to Riot Player support in the form of a ticket, where a member of the Tech Team can analyze and resolve the issue. 

GL:HF!

Hey Slightly Sushi, 

It could be due to something not being up to date, like your graphics card. If your run through our [Crash KB](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974) it should help you a long with patching. If that doesn't help let us know.

If the [server status](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/#) is unavailable then the servers are likely not up at that moment- and you will have trouble downloading the patch. Everything is up and running now so give it another go! If you're still having trouble getting patched up let me know and we'll troubleshoot together!

Hey there!

You might be experiencing the back lash of a bug we mentioned in an update to our post above. If you have LoLReplay or other 3rd party apps installed, our best advice is to temporarily uninstall them. You'll have to remove them completely to eliminate any possibility of them affecting your game, but once things are compatible again you can feel free to reinstall them. :)
